alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 01 at 5:06PM CST until March 02 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SOUTH PLAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SOUTH PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has cancelled the Red Flag Warning. A Fire Weather Watch remains in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon. * Timing...Thursday from 10 AM to 6 PM CST. * Wind...Southwest to west at 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Humidity...15 to 20 percent. * Fuels...Dry to critically dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
